alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Sandia and Manzano Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued March 28 at 2:19AM MDT until March 30 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT TODAY BETWEEN 1 PM AND 7 PM FOR THE NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS AND NORTHEAST PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT THURSDAY FOR THE MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY, SANDIA AND MANZANO MOUNTAINS BELOW SNOWPACK AND ALL OF EASTERN NEW MEXICO DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Southwest winds will return and quickly strengthen this afternoon across northeast New Mexico. With humidity values dipping below 15 percent for a few hours, critical fire weather conditions are expected to the Northeast Plains and Highlands. More widespread critical fire weather conditions will return on Thursday. Very strong southwest winds, low humidity values, and high Haines values are expected. Humidity values may drop into the single digits for a few hours. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Fire Weather Watch...which is in effect from Thursday morning through Thursday evening. * AREA AND TIMING...This includes the Middle Rio Grande Valley (Zone 106), Sandia and Manzano Mountains (Zone 124), Central Highlands (Zone 125) and East Central Plains (Zone 126) from late Thursday morning through Thursday evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 25 to 40 mph with gusts between 50 and 60 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum values ranging between 8 and 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.

area.areaDesc: Central Highlands; East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Sandia and Manzano Mountains
